item.title: Fish market use public footpath to store pallets of goods, 16th October
item.description:
This market seems to think it's acceptable to block the public footpath and right of way with huge towers of food pallets. This is not an acceptable use of public land, this is not their private warehouse to use and they please. Please fine anyone that continues to this. The onus is on them to store their goods on their own premises. The public shouldn't have to suffer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Rye Lane, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Escalating Graffiti problem on Dunstall House, 16th October
item.description:
The wall by the entrance and the one just behind the ATM have been covered with graffiti recently. please clean off both fully. It was only partially done before and now the taggers are targeting it because they know you don't do a full job.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marmont Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Endless rubbish strewn, 16th October
item.description:
The green in Wisley is full of rubbish yet again. Constantly littered. Please clean as residents in that area obviously do not care about their environment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Wisley Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Cover missing from drain access point, 16th October
item.description:
